text:
「這是什麼？博士留下的⋯⋯？」(English below)
艾姆發現一本熟悉的日曆本，更發現 3/11 ~ 3/17 這週有對博士而言意義深遠的日子⋯⋯艾姆想，更加了解博士！（展開文章看麗莎筆記 📖👇）

 ［ 📖3/11（ㄧ）《科學怪人》出版］
這是我每隔一段時間就會拿起來讀的書！作為人類史上第一部科幻小說，它啟發了後世無數科幻創作。

 裡面描述的造物主與被創造生命之間相處的內容，這我可是最清楚了⋯⋯我一定會對創造的行為、對艾姆好好負責的！

 ／

 3/14（四）這一天不只有白色情人節，還有好多值得紀念的日子！

 ［⭕3/14（四）圓週率日］
有了 π、3.14，計算圓周多方便呀⋯⋯不過在銀河曆 160000 年的現在，只要用探測儀輕輕一掃，就能知道星球的周長了，科技真偉大！

 仔細一看，這個圓，突然有點像我一直在尋找的地球呢⋯⋯我相信一定會找到的！

 ［💡3/14（四） 愛因斯坦生日］
地球曆 20 世紀最偉大的科學家的生日！相對論、質能等價改變了當時人類對宇宙的觀念，即使放到幾個世紀後的現在也毫不過時！

 突然想起學生時期上課抄寫 E = mc2 的時候呢⋯⋯

 ［🌌3/14（四）霍金逝世］
令人景仰的天體物理學家史蒂芬・霍金於此日長眠於世。

 他的遺言被傳送至離地球最近的黑洞，長留於宇宙之中，講述關於希望世人在星球上和諧共存的願望。

 也許在我們搭著奧伯斯號尋找地球的路途中，曾與那聲音擦身而過？

 ／

 ［🚀3/16（六）第一枚液態火箭發射］
戈達德於地球曆的今天，發射了人類歷史上第一枚液體燃料火箭「尼爾」，證明液體推進劑是可行的，為後來的火箭升空立了重要的里程碑⋯⋯

 小時候，我曾有機會參觀火箭發射，在那之後就夢想到宇宙中四處旅行⋯⋯我多麼幸運能搭上奧伯斯號。

 Emeth’s found some markings in Dr. Lisa’s old schedule book. Let’s take a look
at what took place on Earth in these dates 📖👇!

 [📖March 11: Frankenstein Published]
It’s the world’s first sci-fi novel! The lesson of the novel is one that I’ve
drilled into my head… Creators must take responsibility for their creations!

 /

 [⭕March 14: Pi Day]
Don’t you think pi’s one of the greatest mathematical constants ever? Pi made it
possible to calculate the circumference easily… 

 Of course, in our current year - a simple scan’s enough to know a planet’s
circumference!

 [💡March 14: Einstein’s birthday]
It’s the birthday of the greatest scientist of Earth Calendar’s 20th century!
The theory of relativity and mass-energy equivalence changed humans’ perception
of space… 

 I remember memorizing E=mc2 during class myself!

 [🌌March 14: Stephen Hawking passes away]
The revered cosmologist Stephen Hawking passed away on this day. His will has
been sent towards a black hole in the silence of space. His message was one of
peace and coexistence.

 Could we have passed by his message on our search for Earth?

Today in Earth Calendar days marks the launch of Goddard’s first
liquid-propellant rocket, “Nell”, proving that it was possible.

Do you remember the #GameBoy that took the schoolyard by storm back in the day?
It's turning 30 years old today 🎉🎉🎉

 Here's a preview of The Legend of OPUS: Songs of the Deep Blue, which is being
brought to the Game Boy! Together with the apprentice magician Emeth, protect
the world from the demon king on the go!

 ----

 The Game Boy is one of the best-selling game consoles ever, and came out in
seven different iterations, such as the original, the Game Boy Color, Game Boy
Advance, and more…

 While you're no doubt familiar with some of them, do you happen to know how the
original Game Boy was different from the rest that came after?

 ----

 🎯The first Game Boy was really different!

 - Thick and heavy: 3.2cm tall, and weighing 220 grams
Only 4 shades of gray available for shading (It took another 9 years to get full
color!😭)

 - Low resolution, only displaying 160x144 pixels
4️⃣AA Batteries required!

 - No backlit screen, so you needed a torch to play in the dark 🔦

 - It could connect to peripheral devices like a printer or camera! 🖨

 ----

 🎯Yet, it took the world by storm.

 Despite the hardware being simple compared to current devices, back then the
Game Boy was the hottest product, selling over 200 million units worldwide. 

 The Game Boy's most popular games were Tetris and Pokemon, with nearly everyone
owning at least one of them.

 ----

 After 16 years, the Game Boy finally ended production in 2005, and our happy
school memories gradually became woven into the tapestry of history…

 But no worries! Even in 2019, The Legend of OPUS: Songs of the Deep Blue is
here to stay. 

 When you feel nostalgic for the legendary grey brick, feel free to come back to
this post and go on a new adventure with Emeth 😂!

.

text:
【今天是人類登上太空滿 58 周年 🚀】(English Below)
在阿姆斯壯前，第一個登上太空的人是誰呢 👨‍🚀？
1961 年的今天，尤里・加加林乘坐飛船勇敢的駛入宇宙，首度實現人類遨遊太空的夢想 💫
親眼從太空眺望家鄉的他獲得深刻體悟，有感而發說的 #這三句話 ，是對地球最深情的告白🌎，留給人類無限啟發...
#點擊圖片 跟艾姆一起看加加林留給我們的禮物 ↓

 ---

 🗣「地球是藍色的⋯⋯這是何等的美好、讓人驚奇。」

 1961 年 4 月 12 日，蘇聯太空人尤里・加加林乘坐的東方一號飛船衝破大氣層，在離地球 301 公里的軌道上繞行了地球一周，實現了人類進入太空的願望 
💫。

 在這 108 分鐘的飛行時間裡，他發現地球竟湛藍如一顆水球，訝異它是如此美麗 🌎。廣闊的大地、巨大的川流、穿透氣層變化萬千的光線，無一不震懾他⋯⋯

 ---

 🗣「遠望地球，我發現它小得禁不起我們互相衝突，卻大得足夠我們合作共存。」

 當時，第二次世界大戰 ⚔️剛結束不久，美國與蘇聯陷入冷戰，開啟了一系列政治、軍事、科技的對抗，關係緊張⋯⋯

 從太空眺望著自己的故鄉，加加林不禁有感而發。

 人類共有的唯一一顆地球，值得好好珍惜 🌱。

 ---

 🗣「沒有什麼能阻止我們。通往群星的道路既陡峭又危險，但我們無所畏懼⋯⋯」

 在美蘇冷戰及太空競賽的背景之下，人類先後發送衛星、載人太空船、太空站至宇宙。許多太空人冒著犧牲的危險，只為了更加接近星星、夢想著於宇宙築夢 👨‍🚀⋯⋯

 ---

 經過一次又一次的宇宙探索，人類在地球通訊、氣象衛星、天文知識等方面終是有了長足的發展 📡。

 2011 年，聯合國大會宣布將每年的 4 月 12 日定為「載人空間飛行國際日」，以紀念這位太空人，以及人類向未知宇宙勇敢邁進的里程碑 🌟。

 #載人空間飛行國際日

 -------- English --------

 It’s the 58th anniversary of the first manned space voyage 🚀!
On April 12, 1961, man’s great space ambition was achieved by Yuri Gagarin,
before Armstrong reached the moon 👨‍🚀. Looking back at the beautiful Earth, he
spoke his deepest thoughts that would inspire for years to come 🌎...

 ---

 🗣 ”The Earth is blue... how wonderful. It is amazing.“

 On April 12, 1961, the Soviet Union’s Yuri Gagarin entered space and circled
around the Earth once. In this 108-minute space flight, he discovered how
beautiful our planet just is 💫.

 ---

 🗣 ”Looking at the earth from afar you realize it is too small for conflict and
just big enough for co-operation.”

 With the end of the Second World War ⚔️still fresh in the memory, the US and SU
were stuck in a Cold War. Looking back at his home from space, Gagarin could
only speak of how the planet should be treasured and shared 🌱. 

 ---

 🗣”Nothing will stop us. The road to the stars is steep and dangerous. But
we're not afraid...”

 In the following “Space Race”, mankind would send up satellites, manned
spaceships, and even a space station into space. Many astronauts have risked
their lives in the dream of traveling closer to the stars 👨‍🚀…

 ---

 In 2011, the United Nations announced that April 12 will be known as the
International Day of Human Space Flight, commemorating Gagarin’s achievement,
and this milestone in human history 🌟.

 #InternationalDayOfHumanSpaceFlight

text:
John’s original character design revealed! The initial design of Rocket of
Whispers had a post-apocalyptic atmosphere. How did we come up with this
character design? Why didn’t we stick with this initial design? Well, let us
explain 👇

 <👕Clothing and Appearance>
Initially, the survival element in Rocket of Whispers was more prominently
featured, so we referenced many post-apocalyptic writings and movies for the
clothes designs. A shortage of supplies means John has to wear clothes he
scavenged, so they don’t fit and are ragged and covered with holes and patches.

 <🛠Tools>
As a scavenger who has to travel long distances, John has a large rucksack
filled with survival items and the most important tool—a shovel.

 At one point John also wielded a pickaxe (a favorite of the dwarfs) and pushed
a shopping cart (you gotta get all the stuff you scavenged home, right?).
However, after considering design aesthetic and animation, we finally decided to
just give him a rucksack and a shovel, creating John’s iconic appearance.

 John’s design is a result of us considering the character, story background,
and in-game environment. The design of a post-apocalypse survivor was revised
over time as the script changed, and we also wanted the character to work well
with the background colors. In the end, we were unable to use all of the
original designs.

The #PlayStation turns 24 today! This best-selling console is the home to many
classics, and has many secrets behind it. Want to know some of them? Just look
below!

 💡 The classic controller design was based on the president’s love for planes?!
Early on, the PS was meant to have a flat controller, but PlayStation designer
Teiyuu Gotou believed that the controller should include two long handles, to
invoke the impression of the PlayStation’s 3D graphics.

 This idea was frowned upon by most executives except for president Norio Oga.
As a plane pilot, the handles reminded him of a plane’s steering wheel, which
led him to support the idea… The rest is history.

 💡 What are the true meanings behind the button shapes?
Another classic change the PS1 brought was a shift from ABXY button denotation
to shape-based denotations. Here are Gotou’s reasonings for the shapes below:

 - Triangle: A viewpoint, meant to resemble a human head, or a direction.

 - Square: Menu, based on the shape of a piece of paper or a document.

 - Circle/X: Confirm/Cancel. An interesting piece of trivia is that in the West,
X means confirm, meaning not everyone is pleased with how it’s arranged. 
#SaveWithX #OhNoMyProgress

 💡 The button layout has everything to do with children
From a clockwise perspective, the button shapes go in this order: 〇 ✕ ▢ △. It
perfectly matches the order of ages when children start to draw those shapes -
Circle (3 yrs old) -> X (3.5 yrs old) -> Square (4 yrs old) -> Triangle ( 5 yrs
3 mos).

 These four shapes aren’t just shapes on a controller anymore - they now
represent the PlayStation brand as a whole on various products!

<Character Design Profile - Fei Lin>
Once upon a time, there was a Nordic girl named…Fei Lin!? This is not a cosplay.
It’s an early design concept for Fei. How did we end up with a such different
outfit today?

 <👕Garments>
Rocket of Whispers is set in a snow-covered country with a European culture, so
we drew much inspiration for Fei’s outfit from garments worn in Northern Europe
and Iceland during the Viking Age, such as animal hide cloaks, tunics, and long
skirts.

 <👑Accessories>
If the weather is cold, put on a wool cap to keep warm. A leather belt wrapped
around the waist is also a common feature in Nordic clothing.

 <👖Legs>
Wool leg wrappings are essential for walking through icy landscapes. Wrap the
leggings from knee to toe and put on a pair of leather shoes with toggles. Now
Fei can explore freely without getting cold!
…
……
………So, why isn’t this design the final version?

 Since Fei is of Asian descent, we thought her outfit should have some Eastern
elements, so we made a lot of adjustments. Once we even dressed her in a
traditional Korean hanbok dress (no joke). Are you guys interested in taking a
look?

text:
<Character Design Profile - Fei Lin>
Our artist digs into early designs of the witch, Fei. And talks about her
transformation from a scrappy, childish teen, to the easy going young adult she
is now
.
<Phase 1 - Scrappy Child>
The original setting for Rocket of Whispers was much bleaker than it is now, and
so we needed Fei (known as Fang at the time) to look tattered, like keeping
herself tidy was a luxury, so everything about her was kind of scrappy. She was
also younger at the time, which made her look very boyish.
.
<Phase 2 - He's a She>
Asian names often don't sound the way they intend to in English, so a very
feminine name like Fang would sound like a pet wolf without the surname to
provide context. Additionally, her tomboyish looks really mislead early Western
playtesters into thinking she was a boy, so we started with making her hair
longer.
.
<Phase 3 - Ponytail>
As a rocket engineer, having long hair can pose a safety hazard. So we tied her
hair up, and added a few years to her age to make her look more mature and
fitting of her position as a religious figure. Thus we ended up with the Fei you
know today!
.
